title: MOD Pizza Ready to Raise Minimum Wages in Some Key Markets
text:
MOD Pizza Ready to Raise Minimum Wages in Some Key Markets Written by: Ruben Ramirez 09/05/15 - 6:15 AM EDT Tickers in this article: SBUX 
NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- MOD Pizza's CEO Scott Svenson said the pizza chain is ready to take on the challenge of raising the minimum wage in some of the key markets over the next two and half years to $15 an hour.Right now, MOD, which stands for Made on Demand, has about 70 locations in 12 markets around the country. The pizza chain has roughly 1,700 employees and hopes to double that number in the next year. 
"Yes, It [the minimum wage hike] will squeeze us. We're up for the challenge. We think that it's a very good challenge to take on," he said. "I think there are a lot of other concepts and brands out there that are not as well positioned to take on that challenge. So while companies like us will have to end up taking a larger percentage of their sales going to labor, there will probably be fewer competitors long term because there will be a natural winnowing out of operators who are not well positioned to take this on." 
Svenson said the pizza chain pays its workers above minimum wage in the markets where it operates. He said he is "building a business that is unapologetically for profit and one that is all about building a fantastic food experience...and our focus is making an impact in the lives of the people that work for us."
